modules.description: This module implements a greedy scheduling algorithm using a machine model. It provides operations to initialize, reschedule, and halt the machine, along with utilities to evaluate and display halted states. Concrete use cases include task scheduling in resource-constrained environments and simulation of machine execution flows.

This module enables parsing, conversion, and documentation of configuration parameters, supporting operations like command-line argument handling, default value assignment, and deprecation management. It works with primitive types (bool, int, float, char, string), collections (lists, arrays, tuples up to t4), optional values, enumerated types, and file/directory paths, using custom separators where applicable. It is particularly suited for building command-line interfaces with structured configuration workflows, automated manpage generation, and gradual migration of deprecated options.

This module provides logging and progress reporting facilities with leveled output (debug, info, warning, error) and structured formatters. It manages program state with halting functionality and integrates configuration parsing and greedy scheduling operations through its submodules. It is used to implement command-line tools with rich diagnostics, structured configuration, and deterministic execution scheduling.
